gallery.description: L-R: Astronauts Gerald Carr and Joe Engle discussing full-scale model of manned lunar roving vehicle.
Apollo astronauts Jack Lousma, seated, and Gerald Carr testing the lunar roving vehicle mobility test unit near Pismo Beach, CA.

crew posing during recovery training aboard " Retriever"

NASA Administrator Dr. James C. Fletcher (left) during visit to Firing Room I during Countdown Demonstration Test
Jim Irwin and Dave Scott during geology training
Irwin posing with Peter MacDonald during geology training session.  MacDonald was a former WWII Code Talker who was elected Navajo Tribal Chairman in 1970
top-down view of Apollo 15 during Countdown Demonstration Test
Worden suiting up for Countdown Demonstration Test
Liquid oxygen vents from Apollo 15 Saturn V space vehicle during "wet" portion of Countdown Demonstration Test
Apollo 15 Commander Dave Scott prior to Countdown Demonstration Test
Irwin suiting for Countdown Demonstration Test
Apollo 15 Command Module Pilot Al Worden prior to Countdown Demonstration Test
Scott and Irwin walk across access arm en route to spacecraft during "dry" portion of Countdown Demonstration Test
Apollo 15 backup crewmembers Richard Gordon (yellow bands on arms and helmet) and Harrison Schmitt during Rover training
Apollo 15 backup astronaut Richard F. Gordon, Jr., examines training model of LRV
Apollo 15 backup mission commander Richard F. Gordon, Jr., left and backup LMP Harrison H. Schmitt, right, during EVA simulation
Apollo 15 backup astronauts Schmitt (left) and Gordon (right) practice surface activity at simulated landing site at KSC
Apollo Backup Astronaut Richard Gordon practice adjusts motion picture camera mounted on a training model of the lunar roving vehicle during a recent exercise at the Kennedy Space Center.
Apollo 15 backup LMP Harrison H. Schmitt gathers simulated lunar rock samples during training exercise at KSC
Apollo 15 backup crewmembers Harrison Schmitt (left) and  Richard Gordon (right) during Rover training
The Apollo 15 crew practices emergency procedures near pad 39-A at Kennedy Space Center
Apollo 15 mission commander David R. Scott walks to a training model of the LRV
Apollo 15 astronaut James B. Irwin practices getting in an out of a full-scale LM training vehicle
Scott and Irwin practice on ladder of full-scale LM mockup
technicians install Boost Protective Cover on Apollo 15 Command Module
David Scott and James Irwin practice nagivational maneuvers in the lunar roving vehicle simulator at the Kennedy Space Center.  Astronaut Joseph Allen is a member of the Apollo 15 support team.
Apollo 15 commander Dave Scott beside T-38 at Patrick AFB a few days prior to launch
David Scott prepares a pilot a T-38 aircraft today on a training flight over the Kennedy Space Center area.
David Scott and Alfred Worden prepare to pilot separate T-38 aircraft on training flights from Patrick Air Force Base.
James Irwin logs his training flight in a T-38 aircraft in the Kennedy Space Center area.
James Irwin logs his training flight in a T-38 aircraft in the Kennedy Space Center area.
Alfred Worden waves to ground personnel at Patrick Air Force Base prior to taking off on a training flight in a T-38 aircraft.

Apollo 15 astronauts David R. Scott (left) and James B. Irwin (right) practice navigational maneuvers in the Lunar Roving Vehicle simulator, assisted by  astronaut Joseph P. Allen IV, support team member.
Dramatic view of Apollo 15 on the pad at night with lightning in the distance
Apollo 15 CMP Alfred M. Worden watches technicians conduct final pressure suit checks prior to launch
A technician adjust David Scott's spacesuit during Apollo 15 prelaunch preparations.
Alfred Worden relaxes during final spacesuit pressure checks prior to his launch to the Moon.
James Irwin undergoes spacesuit pressure check in preparation of his launch to the Moon.
A technician adjust the spacesuit of Apollo 15 astronaut James Irwin prior to his launch.
James Irwin relaxes during suiting up for his launch to the Moon.
The Apollo 15 astronauts undergoing spacesuit pressure checks prior to his launch to the Moon.
Alfred Worden, Harrison Schmitt, and David Scott eats breakfast with Donald Slayton prior to their scheduled launch.
James Irwin eats prelaunch breakfast in the crew quarters at the Kennedy space Center more than four hours before his scheduled launch.
David Scott waves to well wishers as he walks from crew quarter with fellow astronauts James Irwin and Alfred Worden.  A transfer van transported them to Launch Complex 39A.
The Apollo 15 astronauts relax during suiting activities prior to their launch to the Moon today.
The Apollo 15 astronauts leave the Manned Spacecraft Operations Building and enter the transfer van for the nine-mile rid to Launch Complex 39A.

title: Apollo 15 Lunar Liftoff and Return to Earth

gallery.description: flight controllers in Mission Control watch Apollo 15 LM liftoff transmitted by camera on Lunar Rover

The liftoff from the Moon of the Apollo 15 Lunar Module "Falcon" ascent stage  is viewed on the television monitor in the Mission Operations Control Room by Granvil A. Pennington, an Instruments and Communications Systems Officer
The Service Module's SIM bay viewed from LM

Apollo 15 descends on a fouled chute
Apollo 15 CM and chutes in water following splashdown
Apollo 15 CM descends with one fouled chute
The nations most ambitious manned lunar landing mission drew to a successful conclusion at 4:46 pm on August 7, 1971, when the Apollo 15 spacecraft "Endeavor" splashed down in the Pacific Ocean.
The Apollo 15 spacecraft descends safely to the Pacific Ocean on tow of its three parachutes at the completion of the lunar landing mission.
U.S. Navy swimmers jump from helicopter with flotation collar following Apollo 15 splashdown
Dave Scott can be seen inside the CM as a Navy diver opens the hatch during recovery
a Navy diver helps Jim Irwin from the CM during recovery
Apollo 15 recovery operations - crew in life raft
Apollo 15 CM just prior to being brought aboard the U.S.S. Okinawa
closeup of CM hatch after being brought aboard ship
Apollo 15 crew arrive aboard the U.S.S. Okinawa after recovery
Apollo 15 CM aboard U.S.S. Okinawa after recovery
Apollo 15 crew is greeted by Manned Spacecraft Center Director Robert Gilruth as they leave recovery helicopter.
